src:
Enam Bulan Beroperasi, Okupansi Kereta Bandara YIA 30 Persen
05 Nov 2019, 14:26 by Pribadi Wicaksono (Kontributor), Rahma Tri
TEMPO.CO, Yogyakarta - Genap enam bulan setelah resmi dioperasikan pada Mei 2019, kereta Bandara Yogyakarta International Airport (YIA) Kulon Progo ternyata belum banyak dimanfaatkan penumpang. Hingga saat ini, tingkat okupansi kereta bandara tersebut rata-rata baru 30 persen.
"Mungkin karena penerbangan Bandara YIA juga belum full, tingkat okupansi kereta bandara ini masih sekitar 30 persen, memang masih cukup rendah," ujar Manager Humas PT KAI Daop 6 Yogyakarta, Eko Budiyanto saat ditemui di Ambarrukmo Hotel Yogyakarta, Selasa 5 November 2019.
Eko menuturkan, mayoritas penumpang kereta Bandara Kulon Progo ini merupakan wisatawan yang hanya sekadar ingin melihat situasi dan kondisi bandara baru itu pasca-beroperasi. Jadi, penumpang kereta bandara justru bukan penumpang dari kalangan turis yang memang hendak menggunakan jasa penerbangan melalui bandara YIA.
Dari tingkat okupansi itu, Eko memperkirakan yang benar-benar wisatawan mungkin hanya sekitar 15 persennya. "Dulu okupansi kereta itu sempat tinggi saat Sabtu-Minggu, saat bandara baru mulai beroperasi. Saat itu rata-rata penumpang masih ingin melihat Stasiun Wojo dan bandara baru YIA karena rasa penasaran,‚Äù ujarnya.
Eko menuturkan okupansi kereta bandara terkadang naik pada akhir pekan, bisa mencapai 60-80 persen.
Kereta Bandara Kulon Progo sendiri saat ini baru ada satu layanan tiap harinya. Untuk rute dari Yogya ke Kulon Progo, kereta itu berangkat dari Stasiun Maguwoharjo pukul 10.40 WIB dan tiba di Stasion Wojo pukul 11.26 WIB. Sementara untuk layanan dari Bandara YIA ke Yogya, diberangkatkan dari Stasiun Wojo pukul 14.04 WIB dan sampai Maguwoharjo pukul 14.55 WIB.
Adapun kapasitas kereta bandara ini tersedia untuk 199 penumpang duduk. Jika dengan berdiri, tambah 200 orang, berarti total 399 orang. Untuk tarifnya sebenarnya normal Rp 30 ribu namun karena belum lama beroperasi sampai saat ini masih diberi potongan harga 50 persen atau menjadi Rp 15 ribu.
PT KAI optimis okupansi kereta bandara bakal segera naik, seiring jika Bandara YIA mulai beroperasi penuh."Jika penerbangan di YIA sudah betul-betul full, kami yakin masyarakat lebih banyak menggunakan kereta api. Karena tidak macet sekaligus wisata," ujar Eko.
text:
Six Months Operating, YIA Airport Railway Occupancy 30 Percent
05 Nov 2019, 14:26 by Pribadi Wicaksono (Contributor), Rahma Tri
TEMPO.CO, Yogyakarta - Even six months after it was officially put into operation in May 2019, the Yogyakarta International Airport (YIA) Kulon Progo train was apparently not used by passengers. Until now, the airport train occupancy rate has only averaged 30 percent.
"Maybe because the YIA Airport flight is also not full, the airport train occupancy rate is still around 30 percent, indeed it is still quite low," said Public Relations Manager of PT KAI Daop 6 Yogyakarta, Eko Budiyanto when met at Ambarrukmo Hotel Yogyakarta, Tuesday 5 November 2019.
Eko said, the majority of passengers in the Kulon Progo Airport train were tourists who only wanted to see the situation and condition of the new airport after it was operational. So, airport train passengers are not passengers from tourists who really want to use flight services through YIA airport.
From the occupancy level, Eko estimates that there are really only about 15 percent of tourists. "In the past the train occupancy was high during Saturday-Sunday, when the airport was just beginning to operate. At that time the average passenger still wanted to see Wojo Station and the new YIA airport because of curiosity," he said.
Eko said that airport train occupancy sometimes rises on weekends, reaching 60-80 percent.
The Kulon Progo Airport Train itself currently has only one service per day. For the route from Yogya to Kulon Progo, the train departs from Maguwoharjo Station at 10:40 WIB and arrives at Wojo Station at 11:26 WIB. As for services from YIA Airport to Yogya, depart from Wojo Station at 14.04 WIB and arrive in Maguwoharjo at 14.55 WIB.
The airport train capacity is available for 199 seated passengers. If by standing, added 200 people, it means a total of 399 people. The tariff is actually normal, Rp. 30 thousand, but because it has not been operating for a long time, it is still given a 50 percent discount or Rp. 15 thousand.
PT KAI is optimistic that airport train occupancy will soon rise, as if YIA Airport starts to operate fully. "If the flights in YIA are really full, we believe that the public will use more trains.
